thread.title: Westphalia Town Center offers an urban style in the Maryland suburbs
thread.title_full: Westphalia Town Center offers an urban style in the Maryland suburbs - The Washington Post

author: <span itemprop="name">Carisa Crawford Chappell
title: Westphalia Town Center offers an urban style in the Maryland suburbs
text:
Westphalia Town Center is a 6,000-acre community where residences will blend with retail, restaurants, offices and outdoor amenities. (Benjamin C Tankersley/For The Washington Post) Avoiding the cookie-cutter syndrome in the suburbs can be hard with so many new developments mirroring the same design scheme. But a new community in Upper Marlboro, right off Route 4, gives home buyers urban-style townhouses with exteriors and a walkable neighborhoods that seem to mimic city living.
That’s what attracted Charles and Dara Watson to Westphalia Town Center, a 6,000-acre community where residences will blend with retail, restaurants, offices and outdoor amenities.
The couple began house hunting over the summer in Washington, where they both worked. “Needless to say, that was short-lived with our budget. We would’ve either had to buy in a less-than-ideal neighborhood or buy something similar to our current condo,” said Charles. They have lived in their two-bedroom condominium in Capitol Heights since 2007 and plan to move to Westphalia in late spring when their new townhouse is completed.
[ Where Gyro Copters were once made, a D.C. development soars with industrial appeal ] 
While touring the development and looking at the site plan, the Watsons saw that the Mid-Atlantic Builders’ Urban Series was being built in the next lot. “We thought they were single-family homes because they looked so large,” he said.
The Watsons said they felt designs from other builders seemed like what you’d expect to see in suburbia. “But Mid-Atlantic Builders made this unique design that we fell in love with,” said Charles.
